Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2010 10:29AM CrabbyPatti wrote: The core biopsy was yesterday and they didn't have to go into my lung.  The radiologist found 2 spots just above my breast that he could take tissue from.  Maybe it's just me but I didn't get any warm fuzzies from the nurses that were assisting or the radiologist.  Just the way they looked at me didn't make me feel comfortable.  I asked him about the spots in my lung, he said they were probably the same thing. So I'm hoping my onc will have something to tell me tomorrow. It's funny but I'm starting to look around my house for stuff to give away so my husband won't have to deal with it when I die.  Well not funny but I'm sure some of you know what I mean. This seems to be the only place where I feel like I can say what I need to and there are others that understand.
Posts.Title: Possible Recurrence ginnysue kira1234

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2010 05:41AM CrabbyPatti wrote: After 2 years clean, my doc found 4-5 spots on my lung.  I'm scheduled for an MRI tomorrow and core biopsy on Wed.  I was diagnosed Oct 2007, treatments in 2008.  I'm begining to hate October!
Posts.Title: Possible Recurrence ginnysue kira1234

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2011 12:25PM CrabbyPatti wrote: Holy crap! I can relate and know exactly how you feel. I feel like I'm dying a slow death. I'm feeling more and more like a 192 year old woman.
Posts.Title: feeling sorry for myself just need to vent reesie cookie97

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 03:18PM CrabbyPatti wrote: Hi, I'm Patti and I'm living with cancer.  I started out with stage 2, triple negative breast cancer 2007.  When through chemo, surgery, chemo, radiation.  Was in remission for almost 2 years then bam! scan results show numerous tumors in both lungs and 2 in my chest wall.  My friend told me about this site and I've just pretty much been a lurker. It's pretty depressing to see how many people are going through cancer but at the same time it's encouraging to see how strong you all are.
Posts.Title: ...And you are? EnglishMajor keepingon
